original_title: 14 Sri Lankans Repatriated After Failed Illegal Migration Attempt
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Fourteen Sri Lankan nationals were repatriated from the French island of Réunion on December 22nd, 2023, after attempting to migrate illegally by sea. The group, ranging from 21 to 60 years old, hailed from Beruwala, Chilaw, and Kalawanchikudi areas.

Their journeys involved perilous voyages on several fishing trawlers: seven on IMUL-A-0813-KLT in December 2023, two on IMUL-A-0469 NBO in August 2022, three on IMUL-A-0014 CBO in 2018, and two who migrated from Indonesia in 2019.

Upon apprehension, the French authorities repatriated the group aboard UU 0050 aircraft. The Department of Immigration and Emigration and the Sri Lanka Police are now conducting legal proceedings against them.

The Sri Lanka Navy emphasizes the French government's strict stance against illegal immigration to Réunion, stating that apprehended individuals will be immediately repatriated. They urge the public to avoid engaging with human traffickers who exploit desperate individuals with false promises of a better life overseas.
